Name: Large Language Models
Description: Systems that are capable of generating written text in a human-like manner.

Name: Machine Translation
Description: Software that automatically translates text from one language to another.

Name: Facial Recognition
Description: Software that can measure the similarity of faces from images or video, thus recognizing faces.

Name: Latent Diffusion Models
Description: Models that generate arbitrary images from text, image or parameter inputs.

Name: AutoML
Description: Short for Automated Machine Learning, refers to the process of automating the tasks of selecting and fine-tuning machine learning models to real-world problems.
Link: Allows for cheap model fitting wherever small data sets are available.

Name: Speech-to-text
Description: Machine learning models that convert speech of various languages to text.

Name: Text-to-speech
Description: Software that generates speech from written text which sounds like (interesting) human beings.

Name: AGI
Description: Short for Artificial General Intelligence. A hypothetical type of intelligent agent that can learn to accomplish any intellectual task that human beings can perform.

Name: Superintelligence
Description: A hypothetical agent or system that possesses intelligence far surpassing that of the brightest and most gifted human beings in virtually all domains of interest.

Name: Large Multimodal Models
Description: Advanced artificial intelligence systems that can process information from multiple types of data, such as text, images, audio, and video, using powerful pre-trained language models as a core component.

Name: Real time speech translation
Description: Tools that allow to instantly translate speech from one language to another.

Name: Social Media Management and Monitoring
Description: Tracking, analyzing, and responding to content on social media platforms to manage an organization's or individual's online presence and reputation.

Name: TikTok
Description: Social media platform centered around short-form video content, popular for its wide range of user-generated music, dance, comedy, and creative videos.

Name: Metaverse Avatars
Description: Realistic looking Avatars that allow for a seemingly natural presence in the Metaverse.
Link: This technology could allow for a more direct connection during remote meetings.

Name: Atlassian Software
Description: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket are useful technologies, tools for planning, tracking, work organization, document creation, and/or collaborate on code. Products | Atlassian

Name: Multi-stakeholder platforms
Description: Agridata (data exchange platform)

Name: Open government data
Description: Governmental data that is openly accessible to the public. In Switzerland, available open government data is listed on opendata.swiss.

Name: Resource Description Framework
Description: Framework to represent interconnected data on the web (semantic web). Used as standard to describe and visualize metadata.

Name: Linked open data
Description: Linked Open Data is a way of publishing and connecting data on the web using open standards and URIs such that it can be easily accessed, queried, and enriched by humans and machines.

Name: Green-IT
Description: Lösungen zu schaffen und aufzubauen, die Auswirkungen menschlicher Aktivitäten auf die Umwelt zu verringern oder andere umweltfreundliche Maßnahmen im IT-Bereich zu ergreifen.

Name: ESG
Description: Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance. Framework to assess an organization regarding environmenteal, social and governance standards.

Name: i14y
Description: Interoperability platform. Switzerland’s national data catalogue.

Name: Vertical farming
Description: Producing plants in a tightly controlled environment. Decisions about ressources are data driven.

Name: Digital twin
Description: Virtual representation of a system (e.g. a farm) based on sensors and real-time data to make data-driven decisions.

Name: GPU-Clusters
Description: Computer cluster that is equipped with gaphical processing units. Usefull for training and running large machine learning models.

Name: Data Virtualization
Description: Data virtualization is a technology that allows for the retrieval and manipulation of data without requiring technical details about the data, such as how it is formatted or where it is physically located.

Name: Cloud computing
Description: Cloud computing is the delivery of different services through the Internet, including data storage, servers, databases, networking, and software, often providing flexible resources, faster innovation, and economies of scale.

Name: Biomolecular data storage
Description: Store Data in DNA is a promising way. DNA can store a density of 10¹⁹ bits of data per cm3 which is way higher than the actual storage methods. The data will be stored according to the binary code where for instance 00 -> A, 01 -> C, 10 -> G and T -> 11. DNA will be sequenced through NGS (Illumina). BioTech | Free Full-Text | DNA Data Storage (mdpi.com) Example: coded 16GB of Wikipedia in DNA. Startup packs all 16GB of Wikipedia onto DNA strands to demonstrate new storage tech - CNET

Name: Quantum-Computing
Description: Quantum computing is a type of computing that uses quantum-mechanical phenomena, such as superposition and entanglement, to perform operations on data, potentially solving complex problems faster than classical computers.

Name: visualize.admin.ch
Description: Visualization tool for open government data published on LINDAS:

Name: IoT
Description: Network of devices that collect data.

Name: Milking robots
Description: A milking robot is an automated machine designed to handle the entire process of milking dairy cows, reducing the need for human labor in dairy farming.
Link: Could automatically send milk data needed for administrative purposes.

Name: Weeding robots
Description: Robots which specifically target weeds in a field. Weeds may be destroyed using herbicides, hoes, water or lasers.

Name: Digital ear tags
Description: Ear tags that allow to geographically track farm animals.

Name: Variable rate fertilization
Description: Fertilization that locally adapts to the needs of the plants.

Name: Next generation sequencing
Description: Technology used to sequence DNA, RNA. Can be used in several fields like the study of seeds and plant varieties, GMO control. Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) | Explore the technology (illumina.com)

Name: UAV imaging
Description: UAV imaging refers to the process of capturing images and videos from the air using unmanned aerial vehicles (drones), commonly used for purposes like surveying, mapping, and surveillance.

Name: Satellite imaging
Description: Satellite imaging involves capturing images of the Earth from orbiting satellites, which are used for various purposes such as weather forecasting, mapping, and environmental monitoring.
Link: Could be used to determine the vegetation cover period by satellite data.
